lines.text: I know a dog who was so ugly, cars chased him!

[Garfield stayed behind with a goldfish who's a rival on Pet Search]
Where were you, Garfield?

[gulps]
Eliminating some competition.
Well, hurry and get dressed. The show's about to begin.

[entering their dressing room]
Hey, you're on in five minutes. Don't be late.
Come on, guys, let's break a leg!

[after seeing a group of chickens perform]
Those chickens were pretty good.
Yes they are. We must have them for dinner sometime.
No matter how insignificant you are, your pet may be a star!

[rocking in a chair and playing a banjo and singing while his dog moves his tail back and forth under the rocker]
I have a dog, his name is Blue, he sings real good, he sings...
[Blue's tail gets caught under the rocker and he howls]
We're better than that.
[about to destroy John's guitar]

[to Odie, before they knock Jon's guitar over with a lamp]
Not a pretty job, Odie, but - somebody has to do it. Here, gimme a hand.
It looks as though we have our winners - Jonny Bop and the Two Steps!
OK, are we going out there tonight?
Maybe!
Are we gonna get the performance of our lives?
Doubt it!
Are we gonna win?
Not a chance!
All right, let's DO it!
[he and Odie dash away to the stage wing]
[barks]
Let's not, and say we did!
I think we have it wrapped up, guys. I haven't seen any competition so far, and there's only one act *after* us!
[barks]
They're lucky it'll probably be a dog who plays five instruments at the same time.
[For winning at "Pet Search", Jon, Garfield, and Odie are now headed for the nationals in Hollywood and they won $1,000]

Money - big deal. A lot of good money does a cat. And going to Hollywood sounds like a *long* car ride to me. It's not enough that we made fools of ourselves on a local station. Now we've won the right to do it in front of the whole country. Oh, well, maybe things will work out. Maybe the earth will shift and Hollywood will fall into the ocean.
Our final act this evening is Bob the Wonder Dog. He will play five, count them, FIVE instruments simultaneously!
Uh-oh.
Bingo.
[whimpers]
Ladies and gentlemen, our next act is called "Five Tap Dancing Pidgeons and Herbie".
[rushes to Herbie]
Herbie, it can't be easy teaching pidgeons to tap dance.
It's taken me 17 years.

[softly]
It must take a *lot* of dedication.
These pidgeons are my life, you know.

[softly]
Well, best of luck, Herbie.
[announcing]
The stage is yours!

Rehearsing - a lot of good rehearsing that stupid act is gonna do. Well, Jon and Odie can go back to reality if they want to, but *I'm* not. I'm staying. I'm gonna win that talent competition, become a star, and live out my days in the manner in which I'm going to be accustomed.
Wow, just look at all this! Our own private dressing room! Fresh flowers! So this is what stardom is like!

[looking into a rehearsal room]
Hey, they're rehearsing! Let's check out the competition.

[after Miles the Jazz Canary has performed]
Winning all those prizes would be great guys. But getting back to our *real* home will be even greater, right?
He's *got* to be kidding.
[first lines]
Hello, folks, how do you do? Garfield here to entertain you.
[brief moment of silence]
Thank you for that large round of indifference.

[after Odie reveals Bob the Wonder Dog as somebody in a dog costume, the audience boos]
There seems to be a disqualification! Well, those are all the acts, so it's time to let the studio audience determine this week's winner!
[gesturing to the remaining contestants]
May I have all the contestants on stage, please?
This is it. Good luck, boys.
Odie, come here.
[Odie jumps on the bed]
Odie, we're pretty talented, right?
[drum flam as Odie nods]
We're good dancers, right?
[flam]
We went to Pet Search and won, right?
[flam]
And we're gonna win in Hollywood, right?
[drum roll as Odie shakes his head]
Yeah, right, we're not gonna win, right?
[flam]
'Cause our act stinks, right?
[flam]
And whose fault is that?
[roll as Odie gestures to Jon, off-camera]
Right, it's Jon's fault.
I love show business. It's in my blood, in my ears, between my toes, up my nose...

[after he and Odie dance at the Pet Search finals]
We were fantastic; we can't lose! We're number one!
We're rich, we're famous! We'll win the contest and get the show on the road! You guys are fabulous; I had no idea you could dance!
Shucks, that old number? You should see us on the fence.
We'll need costumes, a routine, we'll rehearse day and night!
Day and night? For-get it.

[bringing out his guitar]
And we'll need - some music.
We're in big trouble, Odie. Jon's the worst. We'll be laughed off the air. The show is called "Pet Search", not "*Dummy* Search".

[after he, Garfield, and Odie sing "Wizard of Love" at the "Pet Search" preliminaries]
You guys were *great*!
[Odie barks]
You were awful!
Well, one more act to go and we can collect our $1,000.

[settling into his easy chair before watching "Pet Search"]
Come on, boys, the show is about to start!
[Garfield and Odie scamper in]
Gee, isn't it great to be like a real family to enjoy something together?

[as he, Garfield, and Odie arrive at the WBOR studio for the Pet Search preliminaries]
So this is show business. Pretty glamorous, huh, guys?
Oh, quaint. A low tech studio in a high tech society.
And those other acts look pretty good, too.
Our next act features a rather unique cat and dog duo. From Muncie, Indiana, welcome the Dancing Armandoes!

[as he walks onstage]
This is gonna be a piece of cake.

[after he, Odie, and Jon arrive at their hotel room in Hollywood]
I'm so happy I could just cry - check that.
[jumps onto the bed]
I'm so happy I could just sleep... and dream.
